_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Cloverleaf Cold Storage Co. operates a refrigerated warehouse at 1 Cloverleaf Dr, Monmouth, IL.  

A trained refrigeration engineer operates the ammonia refrigeration system.  The system is comprised of various refrigeration components including compressors, evaporators, vessels, pumps, heat exchangers and condensers.  The ammonia refrigeration system is operated with a variety of safety devices employed within the system, included are high and low pressure automated shutdown system and a level automated shutdown system.  Alarm systems are utilized to provide early detection of problems within the system before a shutdown occurs.  Cloverleaf plants are monitored by a computerized system.  Each system is linked to a twenty-four hour a day third-party alarm monitoring company.  Ammonia sensors are strategically placed throughout the facility to monitor for releases of ammonia.  Based on the readings from these sensors they system will do the following:



At readings of 40 PPM they system will trigger an alarm with the third-party alarm monitoring company who in turn will notify trained staff on the designated call list.  Refer to Personnel response to a potential ammonia release below for further maintenance response.

At readings of 80 PPM the system will close all valve banks serving the affected room.



Engine Room:

At readings of 150 PPM the system will trigger the exhaust fan to ventilate the room and send an alarm to the third-party alarm monitoring company who in turn will notify trained staff on the designated call list.  Refer to Personnel response to potential release below for further maintenance response.

At readings of 4,000 PPM they system will shut down all equipment in the engine room.

At readings of 10,000 PPM they system will shut down power to the entire facility.



Cloverleaf personnel are not trained to respond to an Emergency Situation; therefore emergency services are contacted.  Our emergency response program provides action for employees

,these include: what to do if an ammonia smell is detected, proper evacuation procedures and meeting locations.  Cloverleaf conducts a Fire/Ammonia leak drill annually to ensure procedures are bing followed and are effective.
